Docs.typeparam: The type, must be a generic type, though enforcement of this has to be done only at runtime for practical reasons
Docs.param: The cursor to get the getter for
Docs.summary: The is parameterized by a type that becomes the type parameter for a , and this is generally preferable and more sensible but for various reasons it's often a lot simpler to have a get-getter be over the actual type returned by the getter, that is, parameterize this by the actual type.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRowCursor GetRowCursorShim (Microsoft.ML.Runtime.IChannelProvider provider, Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.ISlotCursor cursor);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRowCursor GetRowCursorShim(class Microsoft.ML.Runtime.IChannelProvider provider, class Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.ISlotCursor cursor) cil managed
Public Function GetRowCursorShim (provider As IChannelProvider, cursor As ISlotCursor) As IRowCursor
static member GetRowCursorShim : Microsoft.ML.Runtime.IChannelProvider * Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.ISlotCursor -> Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRowCursor
public: static Microsoft::ML::Runtime::Data::IRowCursor ^ GetRowCursorShim(Microsoft::ML::Runtime::IChannelProvider ^ provider, Microsoft::ML::Runtime::Data::ISlotCursor ^ cursor);

Docs.param: The channel provider used in creating the wrapping row cursor
Docs.summary: Given a slot cursor, construct a single-column equivalent row cursor, with the single column active and having the same type. This is useful to exploit the many utility methods that exist to handle and but that know nothing about , without having to rewrite all of them. This is, however, rather something of a hack; whenever possible or reasonable the slot cursor should be used directly. The name of this column is always "Waffles".
Docs.returns: A row cursor with a single active column with the same type as the slot type

<Extension()> Public Sub GetSingleSlotValue(Of T) (view As ITransposeDataView, col As Integer, ByRef dst As VBuffer(Of T))

Docs.summary: This is a convenience method that extracts a single slot value's vector, while simultaneously verifying that there is exactly one value.
